alert.note: Alert for Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Salem and central Gloucester Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodstown, or 9 miles east of Wilmington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deptford, Glassboro, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Woodstown, Woodbury Heights, Swedesboro, Beckett, Mullica Hill, Monroe Township, Williamstown, Turnersville, Wenonah and Oak Valley. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
